Title: New Addition - Acne Studios' Latest Collection Is Made Entirely Out of Repurposed Fabrics
Content:
Acne Studios has officially released its third sustainability-focused collection. The adventure-focused pieces in this particular series are completely made out of repurposed fabrics from leftover Acne Studios’ garments from previous seasons.

The capsule is crafted to provide fashionable, yet functional pieces for the hiking world. Additionally, the utilitarian garments are constructed with a tie-dyed pattern, giving the pieces their unique psychedelic foray. The outerwear pieces are produced using nylon fabrics, while the dye used to create a contemporary rendition of the camouflage design is done through environmentally certified dyes.

This season’s sustainability capsule is genderless and multi-seasonal. Three types of fabrics are uniquely merged, transformed and repurposed to create light nylon garments such as in bright pink or coral red. For more heavyweight nylon, the cotton-blend ripstop in khaki green or almond brown offers a more structured silhouette. With Acne shoes you will wrap up the hike-inspired set, that goes with the long-or shoot hooded jacket, short-sleeved trek shirt, trousers, shorts and neck- essential to your next adventure outfit.

You can buy new Acne Studios Sneakers on our website from 19th May .

Title: The YEEZY BOOST 350 V2 "Tail Light" Is Set for a Restock
Content:
The “Tail Light” colorway dropped alongside “Flax” and “Earth” colorways way back in February 2020, with the trio forming one of the label’s rare regional drops. So, only those in Europe, Russia, and Ukraine were able to secure a pair of the “Tail Lights,” while Asia Pacific, Africa, Middle East and India received the “Flax” and “Earth” was given to North America and Latin America.

Take a look at the YEEZY BOOST 350 V2 “Tail Light” above, and pick up a pair of these from our website on July 31. The pair is set to cost 2349 kr (or $220 USD as per usual release prices, if it does drop stateside).

Title: Nike Continues the "NY vs NY" Footwear Series With the Dunk Low
Content:
On this hoops-themed piece, three tones are brought to the table in terms of coloring for its upper half. Landing on the collars, quarter paneling and toe boxes is a drab olive green, while a clean white hue cascades over the surrounding overlays for brighter contrasting. From there, bursts of orange stand out atop the Nike branding on the tongues and heels, the Swooshes as well as the “NY vs NY” logo that is embroidered into the lateral heels. Riding down below is a colorless midsole while a translucent outsole that spells out each of the aforementioned tourneys in vertical fashion.

You can buy NY vs NY Dunks on our web-store.

Title: Walking Shoes for Men That Will Help You Conquer the Trails and the Streets
Content: Walking is good for you—like, really good for you —but the best walking shoes for men haven't exactly always screamed “sex appeal.” Until now. Given the explosion of interest in running’s less strenuous cousin over the past year, walking shoes have, ahem, stepped up their game. They’re still packed with all the cushion-heavy outsoles, breathable uppers, and vital arch support you need for a long day on your feet, but now they’ve got the style to match. Some borrow design details from sleek and modern, some take their cues from retro styles, but all of the ones here will help you get that daily step count in while looking primo with just about anything you’ve got on. Whether you’re heading out for an hours-long stroll or just making a quick trip to the bodega, these are the 7 best walking shoes for men to lace up now.

Title: The Best Shoes For Travelling
Content:
When you’re on holiday, the last thing you want to worry about is painful feet.

When you’ve booked your flights, locked in your accommodation and you’re starting to dream of beachy sunsets or mountain views, you’ve only got one thing left to do: pack your bags.

The ideal travel suitcase contains a mix of multi-purpose items that can be dressed up or down depending on the occasion. Pick a couple of colourful pieces and add a variety of basics: your favourite jeans, a classic white tee, a cosy cardigan and - of course - a pair of go-with-anything, ultra-comfy shoes.

When it comes to travel shoes, look for a pair that will keep you on your feet all day: you never know where your travels might take you - you’d hate to be caught out with a sore blister or aching arches halfway through your adventures.

Elements of the perfect travel shoe:

  • Lightweight
  • Breathable materials
  • Soft fabrics
  • Designed for all-day wear
  • Snug fit for support and stability
  • Can be dressed up or down

At Ian’s Shoes, we pride ourselves on stocking a huge range of lightweight, comfortable shoes - perfect for travelling.

Each and every one of our brands have been selected for their high-quality materials and construction, with a focus on both comfort and style.
